authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
description: Peter Helliar seemed to hint at his aspirations of becoming a reality TV star on Friday and spoke about the South African jungle.
title: Peter Helliar teases fans about arriving in South Africa for I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here
title_page: Peter Helliar teases fans about arriving in South Africa for I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here | Daily Mail Online
text:
He is a world class comedian, film writer and director.
But Peter Helliar seemed to hint at his aspirations of becoming a reality TV star on Friday, when he shared a series of tongue-in-cheek Tweets about joining I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!
Taking to Twitter with a photo of a toy aircraft labelled with the Virgin Atlantic logo, Peter wrote: 'Wow, that was a loooonnnng flight to South Africa. Can't say why I'm here. I'll tell you on Sunday'.
Appearing in the jungle? Peter Helliar seemed to hint at his aspirations of becoming a reality TV star on Friday, taking to Twitter with some cryptic and very suggestive posts
'Wow, that was a loooonnnng flight': The comedian shared a series of tongue-in-cheek Tweets about joining I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!
The prankster also made sure to tag @ImACelebrityAU.
Taking the joke further, the Project panellist then uploaded a subsequent photo to Twitter, which depicted wooden statuettes of a zebra, leopard and giraffe placed upon what appears to be a carpeted floor.
'Great view coming in I must say!!!' quipped Peter in the Tweet, before adding '@ImACelebrityAU #hushhush #ImACelebrityAU #jungle.'
Seems legit? Taking the joke further the Project panellist uploaded a shot of toy animals on a carpeted floor
Probably not, Peter! While the Channel 10 promos have hinted at a world class comedian joining the show's celebrity lineup, Peter fails to meet all the criteria
It didn't take long for the jig to be well and truly up, however, as Peter shared a photo of himself in his lounge room on Instagram, just a few hours later.
Meanwhile, Channel 10 has hinted that a comedian will appear in the midst of the show's all-star line-up.
The clue in question refers to a controversial, world class funny man who has made Australia his home.
Cat's out of the bag! It didn't take long for the jig to be well and truly up, however, as Peter shared a photo of himself in his lounge room on Instagram, just a few hours later
Peter fails to tick all the boxes as he hails from Australia, however.
I'm A Celebrity will feature an array of stars camped out in the middle of Kruger National Park in South Africa jungle, where they will overcome a series of physical and mental challenges over an eight-week period.
They must survive a series of tasks to earn decent meals and special treats, while also surviving the public vote, to win $100,000 for their charity.
I'm A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here! will kick off on Sunday January 31.
